page.title: 07The watercress beds
page.content: The beds are situated on the outskirts of Chilcompton.They were made by putting{concrete}on rough ground and then by adding{gravel}on top.The water is supplied by a{spring}which is deep under the ground.It is so deep that nobody has found the source.The{season for growing watercress begins in late {August}and finishes in the middle of {May.}They usually sell watercress in loads of twenty four baskets at a time or whatever is required.I was told that if you eat bad watercress you get {liverfluke.}She said that watercress contained iron, calcium and Vitamin C. In the Winter they bend the watercress heads down to prevent them from freezing.It was also interesting to know that because it was spring water it was warm.For{seeding}they just cut off the tops of the watercress.It is sent to Bath and sold in many shops.
